summary: This document is a chain of emails between a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena issued to the Interlochen Center for the Arts. The subpoena seeks records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically concerning tuition payments for students. The correspondence details scheduling, compliance, and the confirmation that Interlochen had no relevant payment records.

persons.name: Jeff Jocks
persons.role: Attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts in responding to a federal subpoena seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. He coordinates document production and communication with prosecutors.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: An attorney cc'd on an email from the prosecutor regarding the subpoena to Interlochen. He appears to be involved in the legal response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. The subpoena seeks records of any tuition payments made by him or his entities for students at Interlochen.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-subject of the investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena seeks records related to her as well.

connections.description: Jocks, as attorney for Interlochen, is responding to a subpoena seeking records related to Epstein's potential financial transactions with the institution.
Jocks is responding to a subpoena that also seeks records related to Maxwell in connection with the Epstein investigation.
Both are attorneys involved in the legal response to the federal subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: A federal prosecutor from the SDNY serves a subpoena on Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking records regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Interlochen Reports No Epstein Payment Records
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks informs prosecutors that Interlochen has no documents regarding tuition payments by Epstein or his entities, citing a 7-year record retention policy.

events.title: Agreement on Notifying Former Students
events.description: Prosecutors agree that Interlochen can make reasonable efforts to notify the now-adult former students about the subpoena before compliance.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (Traverse City, Michigan)
Southern District of New York (1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007)
Traverse City, Michigan 49684 (310 West Front Street, Suite 300)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to the Interlochen Center for Arts seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The subpoena specifically sought records of any tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities for students at Interlochen.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeff Jocks, reported that the institution had no such payment records, as they only keep tuition payment information for 7 years.
Prosecutors and Interlochen's attorney agreed that the institution could notify the now-adult former students about the subpoena prior to compliance.
The email chain shows a prolonged investigative effort from February 2020 through March 2021, indicating the scope of the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
